decisions: Use model identity as metadata axis while keeping comparator profile explicit in matrix definitions.
Treat matrix axes as configurable contract dimensions to allow deterministic expansion into executable cells.
Compute WDS, SPR, ECI, BBR, and CMS as first-class scoring outputs; preserve formula transparency in report payloads.
Apply anti-noise controls as execution invariants for core matrix runs; stratify by risk tiers for interpretation.
Flag deterministic regressions as non-promotable regardless of aggregate score to prevent noisy promotions.
phasing: Execution: contracts + orchestration + scoring + aggregation/report semantics
Review: formula/contract conformity and report traceability
Test: determinism, anti-noise behavior, and end-to-end comparative validation
